November 9, 2008: Fiction
EXTREME MEASURES, by Vince Flynn. (Atria, $27.95.) Mitch Rapp teams up
with a C.I.A. colleague to fight a terrorist cell — and the politicians who would rein
them in.
THE BRASS VERDICT, by Michael Connelly. (Little, Brown, $26.) Harry Bosch
and Mickey Haller (the Lincoln lawyer) team up to find a killer.
THE LUCKY ONE, by Nicholas Sparks. (Grand Central, $24.99.) A marine
returning home sets out to track down the woman whose photo he found in Iraq.
BONES, by Jonathan Kellerman. (Ballantine, $27.) The psychologist-detective
Alex Delaware is called in when women’s bodies keep turning up in a Los Angeles
marsh.
THE STORY OF EDGAR SAWTELLE, by David Wroblewski. (Ecco, $25.95.) A
mute takes refuge with three dogs in the Wisconsin woods after his father’s death.
ROUGH WEATHER, by Robert B. Parker. (Putnam, $26.95.) The Boston private
eye Spenser gets involved when a gunman kidnaps the bride from her wedding on
a private island.
A LION AMONG MEN, by Gregory Maguire. (Morrow, $26.95.) A looming civil war
in Oz, seen through the eyes of the Cowardly Lion; Book 3 of the Wicked Years.
TESTIMONY, by Anita Shreve. (Little, Brown, $25.99.) A sex scandal at a
Vermont prep school is caught on tape.
A MOST WANTED MAN, by John le Carré. (Scribner, $28.) Intelligence agencies
converge in Hamburg when a young Muslim man with mysterious connections
shows up.
DARK SUMMER, by Iris Johansen. (St. Martin’s, $26.95.) A veterinarian cares for
an injured dog with an amazing secret.
ONE FIFTH AVENUE, by Candace Bushnell. (Hyperion, $25.95.) The worlds of
gossip, theater and hedge funds have one address in common.
THE HOST, by Stephenie Meyer. (Little, Brown, $25.99.) One woman won’t
surrender to the aliens that have taken control.
HEAT LIGHTNING, by John Sandford. (Putnam, $26.95.) Virgil Flowers
investigates murder cases linked by a lemon in the mouth of each victim.
MILLENNIUM FALCON, by James Luceno. (Del Rey, $26.) Jacen Solo’s
daughter, Allana, discovers a curious device aboard her grandfather Han’s
beloved spacecraft; a “Star Wars” book.
November 9, 2008
Non-Fiction
AGAINST MEDICAL ADVICE, by James Patterson and Hal Friedman. (Little,
Brown, $26.99.) A family’s struggle to get treatment for their son’s Tourette’s
syndrome.
THE SNOWBALL, by Alice Schroeder. (Bantam, $35.) The life of Warren Buffett.
DEWEY, by Vicki Myron with Bret Witter. (Grand Central, $19.99.) The kitten left
freezing in the returned-book slot of an Iowa public library and his rise to fame.
MY STROKE OF INSIGHT, by Jill Bolte Taylor. (Viking, $24.95.) A brain scientist
shares what she learned from her 1996 stroke.
A BOLD FRESH PIECE OF HUMANITY, by Bill O’Reilly. (Broadway, $26.) The
Fox News commentator on his upbringing and career.
HOT, FLAT, AND CROWDED, by Thomas L. Friedman. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux,
$27.95.) How a green revolution can renew America, by the New York Times
columnist.
HERE’S THE STORY, by Maureen McCormick. (Morrow, $25.95.) The life of the
actress who played Marcia Brady.
MULTIPLE BLESSINGS, by Jon Gosselin, Kate Gosselin and Beth Carson.
(Zondervan, $19.) A couple with twins has sextuplets.
THE LONGEST TRIP HOME, by John Grogan. (Morrow, $25.95.) A memoir of
growing up Catholic, by the author of “Marley & Me.”
LETTER TO MY DAUGHTER, by Maya Angelou. (Random House, $25.)
Reminiscences, appreciations and poems from the author of “I Know Why the
Caged Bird Sings.”
THE WAY I AM, by Eminem with Sacha Jenkins. (Dutton, $40.) How the rapper
sees the world, with 250 photographs.
TRIED BY WAR, by James M. McPherson. (Penguin Press, $35.) Abraham
Lincoln as commander in chief, from the author of “Battle Cry of Freedom.”
THE WORDY SHIPMATES, by Sarah Vowell. (Riverhead, $25.95.) A contributing
editor for public radio’s “This American Life” takes a fresh look at the Puritans.
TED, WHITE, AND BLUE, by Ted Nugent. (Regnery, $27.95.) A manifesto by the
rock star, gun advocate and host of an Outdoor Channel hunting show.
BEYOND BELIEF, by Josh Hamilton with Tim Keown. (FaithWords, $23.99.) The
baseball player’s spiritual redemption and recovery from drug addiction.
